intro: Pithecellobium montanum var. variegatum, commonly known as the variegated mountain pithecellobium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often variegated, featuring a mix of green and white or yellow markings, which contribute to its ornamental value. The flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a distinctive sweet scent that attracts pollinators.
